org.magnos.service
Class Service<E>

java.lang.Object
  org.magnos.service.Service<E>
Type Parameters:
E - The event added to the service. Events added to the service are handled in the service's thread by invoking the onServiceEvent method in all attached listeners.
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable, EventHandler<E>, org.magnos.util.Sleepable
Direct Known Subclasses:
AbstractService
public abstract class Service<E>
extends java.lang.Object
implements EventHandler<E>, java.lang.Runnable, org.magnos.util.Sleepable

A service is a more friendly version of java.lang.Thread. A service can have several states and can be restarted (opposed to a once and done Thread). A service can automatically handle events passed to the service. A service also has a set of listeners which will be notified when a change in state occurs (started, stopped, paused, resumed, etc). All listeners will also be notified of the events received in the context of the service's thread. A service is built for optimum performance when state changes are infrequent. Frequent state changes will cause a lot of contention among all threads modifying or viewing the state of the service.

Author:
Philip Diffenderfer

Method Detail

getEventQueue

public org.magnos.util.BlockableQueue<E> getEventQueue()
The queue of events which have been added to the service. Events should not be directly added to this queue unless you mean to purposely bypass all logic imposed by several properties of this Service.

Returns:
The reference to the event queue.

awake

public void awake()

Specified by:
awake in interface org.magnos.util.Sleepable

start

public boolean start()
Starts this service and waits for it to finish starting. If this service is in the Stopping state, this will wait indefinitely until the service has stopped. If the service is in the Stopped state then this service will be started, else this will wait indefinitely until the service is in a started state (Paused, Pausing, Running).

Returns:
True if the service was started, otherwise false.

start

public boolean start(boolean wait)
Starts this service and optionally waits for it to finish starting. If this service is in the Stopping state, this will wait indefinitely until the service has stopped. If the service is in the Stopped state then this service will be started, else this will wait indefinitely until the service is in a started state (Paused, Pausing, Running).

Parameters:
wait - True if the invoking thread should wait until this service is in a started state, false if this method should return immediately.
Returns:
True if the service was started, otherwise false.

start

public boolean start(boolean wait,
                     long timeout)
Starts this service and optionally waits for a maximum amount of time for it to finish starting. If this service is in the Stopping state, this will wait the maximum time until the service has stopped. If the service is in the Stopped state then this service will be started, else this will wait the maximum time until the service is in a started state (Paused, Pausing, Running).

Parameters:
wait - True if the invoking thread should wait until this service is in a started state, false if this method should return immediately.
timeout - The maximum amount of time in milliseconds to wait for the service to start or wait for the service to stop if it is Stopping.
Returns:
True if the service was started, otherwise false.

pause

public boolean pause()
Pauses this service and waits indefinitely for it to be in a resting state (Paused, Stopped). If the service is not started, already paused, or is stopped this will return immediately. If this service is in the Pausing or Stopping state this method will simply wait indefinitely for it to reach its resting state. This pause will not wait for all events to be processed, it will interrupt all processing immediately.

Returns:
True if this service is now in a resting state (Paused, Stopped).

pause

public boolean pause(boolean wait)
Pauses this service and optionally waits indefinitely for it to be in a resting state (Paused, Stopped). If the service is not started, already paused, or is stopped this will return immediately. If this service is in the Pausing or Stopping state this method will simply wait indefinitely for it to reach its resting state. This pause will not wait for all events to be processed, it will interrupt all processing immediately.

Parameters:
wait - True if the invoking thread should wait until this service is in a resting state, false if this method should return immediately.
Returns:
True if this service is now in a resting state (Paused, Stopped).

pause

public boolean pause(boolean wait,
                     long timeout)
Pauses this service and optionally waits a maximum time for it to be in a resting state (Paused, Stopped). If the service is not started, already paused, or is stopped this will return immediately. If this service is in the Pausing or Stopping state this method will simply wait a maximum time for it to reach its resting state. This pause will not wait for all events to be processed, it will interrupt all processing immediately.

Parameters:
wait - True if the invoking thread should wait until this service is in a resting state, false if this method should return immediately.
timeout - The maximum amount of time in milliseconds to wait for the service to be in a resting state.
Returns:
True if this service is now in a resting state (Paused, Stopped).

pause

public boolean pause(ServiceInterrupt serviceInterrupt,
                     boolean wait,
                     long timeout)
Pauses this service and optionally waits a maximum time for it to be in a resting state (Paused, Stopped). If the service is not started, already paused, or is stopped this will return immediately. If this service is in the Pausing or Stopping state this method will simply wait a maximum time for it to reach its resting state. This pause can choose to wait for all events to finish processing, and choose to invoke execute before the service comes to a resting state.

Parameters:
serviceInterrupt - The type of interruption. This can specify whether to finish processing events, or whether to skip execution. This is typically used to ensure that all events that have been added to the service are processed before resting the service.
wait - True if the invoking thread should wait until this service is in a resting state, false if this method should return immediately.
timeout - The maximum amount of time in milliseconds to wait for the service to be in a resting state.
Returns:
True if this service is now in a resting state (Paused, Stopped).

resume

public boolean resume()
Resumes this service. If the service is in the process of pausing this will block until the service reaches the paused state. The service will only resume if it's in the Paused state.

Returns:
True if this service is now in a resumed state (Running, Stopping, Stopped).

resume

public boolean resume(boolean wait)
Resumes this service. If the service is in the process of pausing this will optionally block until the service reaches the paused state. The service will only resume if it's in the Paused state.

Parameters:
wait - True if the invoking thread should wait until this service is in a Paused state if its currently in the Pausing state.
Returns:
True if this service is now in a resumed state (Running, Stopping, Stopped).

resume

public boolean resume(boolean wait,
                      long timeout)
Resumes this service. If the service is in the process of pausing this will optionally block until the service reaches the paused state. The service will only resume if it's in the Paused state.

Parameters:
wait - True if the invoking thread should wait until this service is in a Paused state if its currently in the Pausing state.
timeout - The maximum amount of time in milliseconds to wait for the service to be in a Paused state.
Returns:
True if this service is now in a resumed state (Running, Stopping, Stopped).

stop

public boolean stop()
Stops this service and waits indefinitely for it to be in the Stopped state. If the service is not started, already paused, or is stopped this will return immediately. If this service is in the Pausing or Stopping state this method will simply wait indefinitely for it to reach its Stopped state. This stop will not wait for all events to be processed, it will interrupt all processing immediately.

Returns:
True if this service is now in a Stopped state.

If this service is in the Pausing or Stopping state this method will simply wait indefinitely for it to reach its Stopped state. This stop will not wait for all events to be processed, it will interrupt all processing immediately.

Parameters:
wait - True if the invoking thread should wait until this service is in a Stopped state, false if this method should return immediately.
Returns:
True if this service is now in a Stopped state.

                    long timeout)

This stop will not wait for all events to be processed, it will interrupt all processing immediately.

Parameters:

Returns:
True if this service is now in a Stopped state.

stop

public boolean stop(ServiceInterrupt serviceInterrupt,
                    boolean wait,
                    long timeout)
Stops this service and optionally waits a maximum time for it to be in a Stopped state.If the service is not started, already paused, or is stopped this will return immediately. If this service is in the Pausing or Stopping state this method will simply wait indefinitely for it to reach its Stopped state. This pause can choose to wait for all events to finish processing, and choose to invoke execute before the service comes to a resting state.

Parameters:
serviceInterrupt - The type of interruption. This can specify whether to finish processing events, or whether to skip execution. This is typically used to ensure that all events that have been added to the service are processed before Stopping the service.
wait - True if the invoking thread should wait until this service is in a Stopped state, false if this method should return immediately.
timeout - The maximum amount of time in milliseconds to wait for the service to be in a Stopped state.
Returns:
True if this service is now in a Stopped state.

clear

public void clear()
Removes all events from the service's queue.

addEvent

public boolean addEvent(E event)
Adds the event to the handler. The handler can choose to deny the event from being processed. Even if the handler accepts the event it may not run if the application is being stopped.

Specified by:
addEvent in interface EventHandler<E>
Parameters:
event - The event to add and process.
Returns:
True if the event was accepted, otherwise false.

public boolean waitFor(int desiredState)
Blocks the invoking thread indefinitely until this Service reaches any of the given states.

Parameters:
desiredState - A set of states to wait for.
Returns:
True if any of the states was reached.

                       long timeout)

Parameters:
desiredState - A set of states to wait for.
timeout - The maximum amount of time to wait in milliseconds for the state to be reached.
Returns:

isRunning

public boolean isRunning()
Returns whether this service is running.

Returns:
True if the service is running, paused, or is pausing.

isResting

public boolean isResting()
Returns whether this service is in a resting state.

Returns:
True if the service is stopped or paused.

getListeners

public org.magnos.util.Notifier<ServiceListener<E>> getListeners()
Returns the notifier which manages the listeners to events on the service. ServiceListeners can be directly added and removed to the notifier. Avoid invoking the methods of the proxy object in the notifier since it may notify the listeners falsely when an event has not actually occurred with the service.

Returns:
The reference to the ServiceListener notifier.

getRelease

public org.magnos.util.Release getRelease()
Returns the release object. This is used to unblock any blocking calls in any implementing services. The only time unblocking calls need to be interrupted is when the service is trying to paused or stopped.

Returns:
The reference to this Service's release.

getRemainingEvents

public int getRemainingEvents()
Returns the remaining number of events this service can process before it automatically stops. If this returns -1 then this service will process events until the service is stopped.

Returns:
The maximum number of events this service will handle.

setRemainingEvents

public void setRemainingEvents(int remainingEvents)
Sets the remaining number of events this service can process before it automatically stops. If this returns -1 then this service will process events until the service is stopped.

Parameters:
remainingEvents - The maximum number of events this service will handle.

getRemainingIterations

public int getRemainingIterations()
Returns the remaining number of iterations this service can process before it automatically stops. An iteration is considered one round of processing events and an execute. If this returns -1 then this service will run indefinitely.

Returns:
The maximum number of iterations this service can perform.

setRemainingIterations

public void setRemainingIterations(int remainingIterations)
Sets the remaining number of iterations this service can process before it automatically stops. An iteration is considered one round of processing events and an execute. If this returns -1 then this service will run indefinitely.

Parameters:
remainingIterations - The maximum number of iterations this service can perform.

getRemainingExecutes

public int getRemainingExecutes()
Returns the remaining number of executions this service can perform before it automatically stops. If this returns -1 then this service will execute until the service is stopped.

Returns:
The maximum number of executions this service can perform.

setRemainingExecutes

public void setRemainingExecutes(int remainingExecutes)
Sets the remaining number of executions this service can perform before it automatically stops. If this returns -1 then this service will execute until the service is stopped.

Parameters:
remainingExecutes - The maximum number of executions this service can perform.
